title: Republican Senator Rand Paul is harassed by a fellow diner while eating
text:
Footage shows Senator Rand Paul being blasted by a woman who claims she won't tolerate his 'Republican bulls**t.'

Sergio Gor, a staffer for the Senator, posted a video showing two people confronting the Kentucky politician about his political views as they were lunching.

The Republican lawmaker is on tour promoting his new book The Case Against Socialism and was in California when the exchange happened on Friday.

Footage shows Republican Senator Rand Paul, (right), being verbally attacked by a woman, (left), who claimed she won't tolerate his 'Republican bulls**t'

Rand, 56, is heard attempting to respond to a man who asks to speak to him. An official, believed to be with Rand Paul, can be heard saying: 'Stop being rude.

He then responds: 'I'm not being rude, he's a public official, I have a right to speak to him.'

A woman then comes into view with her phone in her hand and shouts: 'You just ran into two people from New York, kiddo, and we're not putting up with your Republican bulls**t!.'

The man is then heard saying: 'All I am saying is that while you and I possibly, probably, don't have much in common politically, right? We are Americans.'

Paul retweeted the video and said that while 'The left blames incivility' on Donald Trump, he urged voters to 'watch this video and decide who the rude ones are.'

Sergio Gor posted the video with the caption: 'While having lunch with @RandPaul in California, we got verbally assaulted by these aggressive libs complaining about incivility. Check out the vid! #unhinged.'

Former Republican Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee was one of the first people on Twitter to defend Paul. Reposting the the video, he said in a Tweet: These unhinged old loons screaming at @RandPaul are probably someone's grandparents.

Do they hope their grandkids turn out like this? I actually feel sorry for them. Do they really think they are winning? Uncorked rage, hate, and vile. They need help.'

Similar incidents involving Republicans have occurred in the past, including Sarah Huckabee Sanders being refused service at a restaurant in Virginia last year.

A man first approaches Rand Paul calmly and asks to speak to him at a California restaurant

A woman then comes into view with her phone in her hand and shouts: 'You just ran into two people from New York, kiddo, and we are not putting up with your Republican bulls**t!'

Stephanie Wilkinson's move to ask Sarah Sanders to leave the Red Hen in June 2018 when she arrived with seven family members was met with public outrage and support.

Following the incident Sanders tweeted about the encounter saying she 'politely left' and '[Wilkinson's] actions say far more about her than about me.

'I always do my best to treat people, including those I disagree with, respectfully and will continue to do so.'

Wilkinson said that her employees felt uncomfortable having Sanders there and took a vote before asking her to leave.

On Tuesday June 25 Eric Trump was visiting Chicago for work when he walked into the upscale Aviary bar - run by the famed chef Grant Achatz.

After entering a female server approached him and allegedly spat on him.

Paul's deputy chief of staff Sergio Gor posted a video showing two people confronting the Kentucky politician about his political views as they were lunching

Senator Rand Paul is seen with his wife author Kelley Paul in New York on October 11

U.S. Secret Service took that employee into custody and Chicago Police arrested her. Eric then asked Chicago Police to let her free when told she would otherwise be charged.

Alinea Group, which runs the bar, says that the employee has been placed on leave.

Last year Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell was confronted by hecklers at a restaurant in Kentucky as he was dining with his wife.

One of them shouted at him: ‘Why don’t you get out of here? Why don’t you leave the entire country?.'

The incident took place in Havana Rumba last November, where four men were seen confronting the Kentucky Republican while he was having dinner with his wife, Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao.

Mitch McConnell, a Republican from Kentucky, was confronted by critics at a restaurant in his home state last year, while Sarah Sanders was refused service at a restaurant in Virginia

Before the incident was captured on amateur cell phone video, one of the men slammed his fists on McConnell’s table, grabbed his doggie bag, and threw the food out of the restaurant, according to TMZ.

The hecklers were particularly angry over McConnell’s stated intention to tackle ‘entitlement reform’ - which most likely means cuts to Social Security and health care.

Before the woman who filmed the incident began recording, she said that one man in particular accused of McConnell of killing people with his views, TMZ reported.

The Majority Leader appeared unfazed, according to witnesses. He continued dining and then left.

As he was leaving, he shook hands with a number of his supporters, witnesses told TMZ.

Earlier this year, Rand Paul was awarded more than $580,000 in damages in a lawsuit against the neighbor who tackled him and broke several of his ribs in a dispute over lawn maintenance.

A jury in Bowling Green, Kentucky, deliberated for less than two hours before delivering the award to the Republican lawmaker, 56, who was attacked while doing yard work at his Kentucky home.

Paul had testified during the three-day trial that he feared for his life as he struggled to breathe after Rene Boucher slammed into him in their upscale Bowling Green neighborhood in late 2017.

The jury awarded $375,000 in punitive damages and $200,000 for pain and suffering, plus $7,834 for medical expenses.
description: Republican Senator Rand Paul was blasted by a diner at a restaurant on Friday who told him she would not tolerate his 'Republican bulls**t.' Paul is in California to promote his new book.
